title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez states he's fine after leaving an NFL game with a head injury in the fourth quarter.
Gonzalez underwent concussion protocol and was cleared to return, though he wasn't needed as Patriots closed out the game.
Atlanta's Drake London had nine receptions for 118 yards and three touchdowns, including a notable 40-yard catch over Gonzalez.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected nearly 180 discarded needles in six days at Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting ongoing safety concerns.
Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly for harm reduction, but calls to reduce this number have intensified.
Councilor Ed Flynn urges stronger response to drug use in parks, advocates more resources for needle pick-up in Boston.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant expressed optimism about Jayson Tatum's Achilles recovery, noting Tatum's progress six months post-injury.
Durant highlighted the advancements in medicine, stating Tatum appears ahead of Durant's own recovery timeline.
Tatum is considering a return during the 2025-26 NBA season, though Durant suggests a cautious day-by-day approach.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings honor late family friend with standout performances in Patriots' 24-23 win over Falcons.
Douglas achieved his first 100-yard NFL game, catching a touchdown after learning of his uncle's death.
Terrell Jennings scored his first career NFL touchdown, stepping up due to other players' injuries.

title: Mike Vrabel shares message to Patriots, Drake Maye after nail-biting win over Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots secured a 24-23 victory over the Atlanta Falcons at Gillette Stadium despite turnovers and defensive struggles.
Drake Maye threw for 259 yards with two touchdowns but committed two turnovers leading to Falcons' points.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized the importance of joy and camaraderie, encouraging the team to embrace their success.

title: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren dies ‘unexpectedly’ at 55
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Former Newton Mayor Setti Warren died unexpectedly at his home in Newton on Sunday at the age of 55.
Warren, the first African American elected as mayor of a Massachusetts city, led Newton from 2009 to 2018.
He was serving as Director of the Institute of Politics at Harvard's Kennedy School at the time of his passing.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against Falcons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: DeMario Douglas had a breakout game with a career-high 100 receiving yards, including a 58-yard catch.
Atlanta exploited Marcus Jones' height mismatch for two touchdowns, contributing to 14 of their 23 points.
Patriots' offensive line allowed six sacks, impacting both the run game and pass protection against the Falcons.

title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey results show 33.7% of respondents feel less safe downtown compared to early 2025, down from 70.6% in 2024.
Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed safety issues with officials, law enforcement, and community leaders present.
Retail vacancies at their lowest since COVID-19 as residents report feeling safer, boosting business interest downtown.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ 24-23 win over the Falcons
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to six games with a narrow 24-23 victory over the Falcons at Gillette Stadium.
Rookie QB Drake Maye records 259 passing yards, two touchdowns, but also commits two turnovers against Atlanta.
Missed extra point by Falcons kicker Parker Romo secures the Patriots' win, avoiding potential overtime scenario.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten people, including a Lynn man and his grandmother, indicted in Massachusetts sex trafficking case spanning several counties.
The Lynn man, Gianni Martinez, charged with multiple counts including trafficking, rape, and conspiracy from jail.
Grandmother Rosa Garcia charged with deriving support from prostitution and money laundering; others also face trafficking charges.
